result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael T Nelson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $510 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: with Huber and Good Time Credit

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael T Nelson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: 10:55 am cases called. 16CM77, 16TR387 & 16TR388. Defendant Michael T Nelson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record by ADA Anderson.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses outright Count 2 & dismisses and reads-in 16TR387 & 16TR388. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. CONDITIONS: 5 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 days served. To begin no later than June 1, 2016. 48 hour rule. $1429.00 inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond to be applied. 12 month DL revocation, 12 mo IID effective today, OWI Assessment. AODA & follow through,   Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on April 19, 2016 at 09:35 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 2:24 PM: Defendant Michael T Nelson in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def will waive his right to counsel at this time.  NGP received and entered.  NGP entered to civil citations as well.  Court orders $500 cash bond w/conditions.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 01:45 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 09:35 am.
